page.title: 20EDUCATION IN IXWORTH
page.content: In Ixworth there is a voluntary Play- Group run for children from 3 to 5 years. For a small sum parents can send their children for up to three mornings each week. Officially every child must attend a school from its 5th birthday. In this part of Suffolk children attend a Primary School from 5 to 8 years old. From 9 to 13 they attend the Middle School and then they transfer to the Upper School at Thurston until they reach the legal age of leaving (16). Some pupils remain for two more years to take Advanced level Examinations. Most of these then go to Universities, Colleges or Polytechnics. Evening Classes are held for adults. Many of these are for leisure pursuits including foreign languages. Academic courses are held but these are usually at the West Suffolk College in Bury.
